oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson equestrian statue in Nashville, Tennessee, 1897 October 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An 1897 photograph of the equestrian statue of Andrew Jackson Statue located on the grounds of the Tennessee State Capitol in Nashville, Tennessee. A group of ladies in 19th century attire are pictured in front of the statue and several large residential mansions can be seen in the background. This statue depicts Andrew Jackson at the Battle of New Orleans and was sculpted by American sculptor Clark Mills. The statue is the first design of a person on horseback ever cast in the United States. It is one of three identical statues located at Nashville, New Orleans, and Washington, D.C. respectively. The monument was dedicated during Nashville's centennial celebration in May 1880. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 5 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mills, Clark, 1810-1883; Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845--Statues
